alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Central Middlesex County; Eastern Essex; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southeast Middlesex; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Southern Worcester; Suffolk; Western Essex; Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE FRIDAY... Anomalously warm temperatures and dry conditions will continue today, especially across the interior where temperatures will warm into the upper 80s and low 90s as minimum RH values drop to between 20-30%. While winds will be less breezy than days past, persistent dry antecedent conditions and low relative humidity values are the driving factors for elevated fire weather concerns today. The primary threat for fire weather concerns will be during the morning hours for eastern Massachusetts before a wind shift to the east causes temperatures to drop and RH values to rise dramatically this afternoon. Temperatures will remain consistently warm and RH values low across western Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut, where fire weather concerns will be heightened all day.
